I cannot predict the alternate reality, but it can be suggested that the world would have been very different if the slave trade had never been abolished. the slave trade was a terrible crime against humanity, and as we know, it caused profound suffering and enduring harm. if it had continued, it would have perpetuated a system of racism, exploitation, and oppression that would have significantly hindered human progress and social justice.

furthermore, the abolition of the slave trade was a significant step towards human rights and equality. it helped to shift global attitudes towards race and human dignity, and led to the growth of further social justice movements. if the slave trade had continued, it would have been much harder to imagine a world where human rights and equality were viewed as essential principles.

in summary, the abolition of the slave trade was a crucial step towards human progress and social justice, and it is hard to imagine what the world would be like if it had not been abolished.
